paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Two BRCA2 variants of unknown significance were identified, with details on their clinical significance, patient demographics, penetrance data, and functional information.

patients.phenotype: Melanoma, potential predisposition to breast and prostate cancers

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The c.9334G>A variant, classified as a rare variant of unknown significance, on current evidence may predispose to cancers of the breast, prostate and melanoma.
The c.9334G>A variant, classified as a rare variant of unknown significance, on current evidence may predispose to cancers of the breast, prostate and melanoma.

functional_data.summary: The MutationTaster, Polyphen2 and SIFT algorithms indicate that c.9334G>A is a damaging variant.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregated with the disease.
variants.population_frequency: Absent among unselected cancer patients and healthy controls.
variants.evidence_level: Current evidence suggests potential predisposition to cancers.
variants.additional_notes: Functional studies to describe how the DNA change affects the protein function and a large multi-center study to evaluate its penetrance are required.
key_quotes: The c.9334G>A variant, classified as a rare variant of unknown significance, on current evidence may predispose to cancers of the breast, prostate and melanoma.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The c.4534 C>T variant did not segregate with disease, there was no LOH of the variant.

functional_data.summary: No functional impact was established as it did not segregate with disease.

variants.population_frequency: Absent among unselected cancer patients and healthy controls.
variants.additional_notes: Functional studies are needed to clarify the role of this variant.
key_quotes: The c.4534 C>T variant did not segregate with disease, there was no LOH of the variant.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
